thread.section_title: The Sports Illustrated HTML Sitemap Index for December, 2014 - SI.com
thread.title: Edmonton Oilers 2015-16 preview - NHL

title: Edmonton Oilers 2015-16 preview - NHL
text:
by Allan Muir Twitter Email Posted: Sat Oct. 3, 2015 COACH: Todd McLellan
2014-15 RECORD: 24-44-14, 62 points (sixth in Pacific, missed playoffs)
VITAL SIGNS: 2.35 goals-for per game (26th); 3.37 goals-against per game (30th); 17.7 power play pct. (19th); 76.7 penalty kill pct. (28th); PDO: 97.0 (30th); Corsi For pct.: 48.9 (22nd); Fenwick For pct.: 48.4 (23rd); face-off pct.: 48.2 (25th)
NOTABLE ARRIVALS: F Connor McDavid , F Mark Letestu , F Lauri Korpikoski , D Griffin Reinhart , D Andrej Sekera , D Eric Gryba , G Cam Talbot , G Anders Nilsson
NOTABLE DEPARTURES: F Boyd Gordon , F Matt Fraser , D Martin Marincin , G Viktor Fasth
PROJECTED DEPTH CHART
Forwards
Taylor Hall – Connor McDavid – Teddy Purcell
Benoit Pouliot – Ryan Nugent-Hopkins – Leon Draisaitl
Nail Yakupov – Anton Lander – Anton Slepyshev
Matt Hendricks – Mark Letestu –Lauri Korpikoski
Defensemen
Andrej Sekera – Andrew Ference
Oscar Klefbom – Justin Schultz
Eric Gryba – Griffin Reinhart
Goaltenders
Cam Talbot
Ben Scrivens
OUTLOOK: New GM. New coach. New players.
New hope.
This won’t be the season that everything changes for the Oilers —their nine-year absence from the postseason will surely stretch to 10—but it’s certainly the season when everything starts to change.
NHL Video Anaheim Ducks 2015-16 preview by Nick Forrester
